alert.note: Alert for Spotsylvania; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 10:43PM EST until further notice by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Baltimore MD/Washington DC has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Virginia... Rappahannock River above Fredericksburg affecting Spotsylvania and Stafford Counties. For the Rappahannock River...including Remington, Fredericksburg, Fredericksburg...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rappahannock River above Fredericksburg. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water covers the Riverside Trail off River Road upstream of Fredericksburg. Water also enters a building at a riverside wedding venue, and begins to cover the parking lot at the Motts Run boat landing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 7.7 feet, or 5.3 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Please visit weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Wed Wed Wed Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7AM 1PM 7PM Stg Time Date Rappahannock River Fredericksburg 13.0 7.7 Tue 10 pm 10.3 12.5 12.8 12.8 7pm Wed &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/washington or weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 645 AM EST.
